intro: Xeropappus lanuginosus, commonly known as the woolly cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its fuzzy, woolly leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its structure and growth habits make it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping in dry landscapes.
